definition: character book (i.e. school primer)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: Life is just like a wordless book, on which need you to write down the most beautiful words.
sentences.chinese: 人好像一本无字书，需自己写上最美的文字。

sentences.english: Recorded in the words of their book "History of Zhou chapter" and named.
sentences.chinese: 因其着录于字书《史籀篇》而得名。

sentences.english: I could read books very early in this way.
sentences.chinese: 这样，我很早就会看字书了。

sentences.english: I read books, and Dad recommended books in written words to me intentionally.
sentences.chinese: 我看书，爸爸还有意向我推荐字书。

sentences.english: Yupian" is the first Chinese dictionary written in regular script."
sentences.chinese: 《玉篇》是中国古代第一部以楷书为主要形体的字书。

definition: the Kangxi Dictionary, named after the Kangxi Emperor, who in 1710 ordered its compilation, containing 47,035 single-character entries
Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century

Six Methods of forming Chinese characters, according to Han dictionary Shuowen 說文|说文 - namely, two primary methods: 象形 (pictogram), 指事 (ideogram), two compound methods: 會意|会意 (combined ideogram), 形聲|形声 (ideogram plus phonetic), and two transfer methods: 假借 (loan), 轉注|转注 (transfer)
old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
rime dictionary (ancient type of Chinese dictionary that collates characters by tone and rhyme rather than by radical)
Thousand Character Classic, 6th century poem used as a traditional reading primer
surname Zhi
variant of 帙[zhi4]/variant of 秩[zhi4]/(classifier) ten years
book cover

the Thirteen Confucian Classics, namely: Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], Book of History 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], Rites of Zhou 周禮|周礼[Zhou1 li3], Rites and Ceremonies 儀禮|仪礼[Yi2 li3], Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], Mr Zuo's Annals 左傳|左传[Zuo3 Zhuan4], Mr Gongyang's Annals 公羊傳|公羊传[Gong1 yang2 Zhuan4], Mr Guliang's Annals 穀梁傳|谷梁传[Gu3 liang2 Zhuan4], The Analects 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], Erya 爾雅|尔雅[Er3 ya3], Classic of Filial Piety 孝經|孝经[Xiao4 jing1], Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3]
printed book/copy
Hanyu Da Zidian, one of the most comprehensive Chinese character dictionaries with 54,678 (and later 60,370) entries, first published between 1986-1990
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write
commentary and subcommentary (of a book)
variant Chinese character
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
Cihai, an encyclopedic dictionary first published in 1915, and frequently revised
